item.title: Notes on Golang
item.description:
Design Principles

Orthogonality: Pieces are independent to each other.

Simplicity: less techniques (inheritance, vtable overrides).

Readability: Reduce clutter and noise.

Untyped constants

An untyped constant is pretty much a literal; It doesnt have a type of its own altough it haves a default type that is used when no other type can be inferred.

For example this works:

const x = 1 var y int = x var z byte = x var w float = x
